revised_title: Magnetism Diurnal Inequalities and the Impact of a Great Cosmical Change
tldr: The author, George Biddell Airy, presents a study of diurnal inequalities of terrestrial magnetism based on observations made at the Royal Observatory, Greenwich, from 1841 to 1857. He discusses the impact of a great cosmical change that affected all phenomena of terrestrial magnetism during this period. The study also highlights the changes in the magnitude and form of diurnal curves representing the hourly magnetic forces in the horizontal plane.
